messages.title: A LABOUR GOVERNMENT OR TORY GOVERNMENT?
messages.content: Only Labour can beat SNP in Edinburgh North and Leith. At the last Westminster election, turnout was 71%, with SNP (40%) winning to SNP (31%), with Labour a close second and the Conservatives a poor third, with 16% of the votes.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Labour will open up the Arts, and Creative industries to everyone. Labour will maintain free entry to museums. Labour will end Tory and SNP cuts to Council budgets to support the provision of libraries, museums and galleries.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Only Labour can beat SNP in Edinburgh North and Leith. At the last Westminster election, turnout was 71%, with SNP (40%) winning to SNP (31%), with Labour a close second and the Conservatives a poor third, with 16% of the votes.

leaflet.personalStatement: Q: Why Westminster? A: I want to make Westminster work for all, not just the few. Representing the area as a Councillor for over 13 years has been an honour. We need more voices from Local Government in Parliament, representing what works there.

politicalExperience.achievements: Representing the area has been an honour. We need more voices from Local Government in Parliament, representing what works there.

images.caption: Gordon with his wife Alison and a celebratory guest
